result.execSummary:
The defendant Jamie R. Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 70 days if revoked.
Probation may be transferred to county in which the party resides.

miscConds.notes:
DNA sample unless already provided.
Participate in AODA and follow through with any recommended treatment. 
Maintain absolute sobriety from all illegal drugs and alcohol. 
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances.
No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. 
Participate in counseling as deemed beneficial by agent. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full time employment 30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jamie R. Johnson

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
1:45 PM/Room 301. Defendant Jamie R. Johnson appeared in court, in custody at Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. Def. has previously waived right to counsel, still wants to represent self. State recites agreement. Def. to plead to all three counts. Joint recommendation: Ct. 1 withheld sentence, 3 years probation, costs, AODA and follow through with any recommended treatment, maintain absolute sobriety, no illegal use or possession of controlled substances,  banned from Class B establishments, restitution of  $267.85, maintain fulltime employment, counseling as deemed necessary by agent. Ct. 2 - imp/stayed 6 months jail, 2 years probation, costs, comply with same conditions as Ct. 1. Ct. 3: 30 days jail, consecutive to Ct. 2, 2 years probation, costs, comply with conditions in Ct. 1.  State has complied with victim rights. Def. agrees with terms. Waiver of preliminary hearing orally reviewed. Def. waives P.H. Court accepts waiver of P.H., finds probable cause and binds matter over for filing of Information. Def. has copy of Information, waives reading. Plea questionnaire reviewed.
Def. pleads to Ct. 1 - Poss of Meth, no contest; Ct. 2 - Retail theft, no contest; Ct. 3 - Poss. illegally obtained prescription, no contest. Constitutional rights, elements and possible penalties reviewed. The Court finds that Def. understands and that pleas are freely and voluntarily given. The Court finds there is a factual basis, accepts pleas and finds Def. guilty of Ct. 1, Ct. 2 and Ct. 3. Sentencing remarks by State. Def. makes statement. Court questions Def. Remarks by the Court. 
The Court will abide by agreement, orders 
Ct. 1 - withheld sentence, 3 years probation, court costs only including DNA surcharge, DNA sample unless already provided, participate in AODA and follow through with any recommended treatment, maintain absolute sobriety from all illegal drugs and alcohol, no illegal use or possession of controlled substances, no presence in establishments with Class B liquor license, payment of restitution of  $267.85, maintain fulltime employment 30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for, participate counseling as deemed beneficial by agent. 
Ct. 2 - imp/stayed 6 months jail, Huber, 2 years probation, costs only including DNA surcharge, comply with same conditions as Ct. 1.  Court clarifies that restitution applies to Ct. 2 only.
Ct. 3 - imp/stayed 30 days jail, Huber, consecutive to Ct. 2, 2 years probation, costs, comply with conditions as set forth in Ct. 1. 
70 days credit if revoked.  Firearm/voting rights. 
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Post-conviction rights. Probation may be transferred to county in which the party resides.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 3, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Status conference on July 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on August 3, 2022 at 10:45 am.

02:34 PM Defendant Jamie R. Johnson in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jamie R. Johnson appeared by video means. All parties via zoom.  Waiver of right to atty filed and Court goes over form with def. Court finds waiver of atty right is freely & voluntarily given.  Def. waives time limits for p.h. Court accepts waiver of time limits for p.h. Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.

03:56 PM Defendant Jamie R. Johnson in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jamie R. Johnson appeared by video means. All parties via zoom. Def. is eligible for P.D. and would like to continue without an attorney.  Waiver of Right to Attorney sent over to jail. Bond continues.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No illegal use or possession of controlled substances.
No contact with Walmart.

02:18 PM Defendant Jamie R. Johnson in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jamie R. Johnson appeared by video means.  All parties via zoom.    Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. is going to contact P.D. State gives bail/bond recommendation and request $2,000 cash bond with conditions No illegal use or possession of controlled substances and No contact with Walmart. Def. heard on bond.  Court orders $2,000 cash bond with conditions No illegal use or possession of controlled substances and No contact with any Walmart Stores.  Def. would like lesser bond. Court denies and adjourns.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
